Answers.MP Summary: set the keyboard using the X Keyboard Extension
Answers.Most Similar TLDR Task: Set the keyboard in French AZERTY
Top-3 Similar Questions: au_45203: How can I assign a middle button press to a specific key in my laptop?
Top-3 Scripts:
au_45203: setxkbmap -layout gb

setxkbmap -query

#!/bin/sh
setxkbmap -layout gb
xkbset m
xkbset exp =m
xmodmap -e "keycode 135 = Pointer_Button2"

Explanations about Options.-layout:
Specifies the name of the layout used to determine the components which make up
 the keyboard description. The -layout option may only be used once. Multiple
 layouts can be specified as a comma-separated list.

Top-3 Scripts: so_48645586: sudo modprobe -r psmouse; sudo modprobe psmouse

Explanations about Options.-r:
This option causes modprobe to remove rather than insert a module. If the modules it
 depends on are also unused, modprobe will try to remove them too. Unlike insertion,
 more than one module can be specified on the command line (it does not make sense to
 specify module parameters when removing modules).
